article_text:
The White House is crowing about the budget results for fiscal 2015, which ended September 30, and it’s true that Americans have been very generous to Washington. The federal government can celebrate record revenue of $3.249 trillion thanks to an 8% increase in receipts for the year.

The revenue boom includes a huge 10.3%, or $144 billion, increase in individual tax payments to $1.538 trillion. Corporate tax receipts were only a little less generous, growing 7.3% to $344 billion. Payroll taxes continued their steady...

twitter.description: Taxpayers provide an 8% increase in revenue, but entitlements keep rising, the Wall Street Journal writes in an editorial.
twitter.title: Washington’s Revenue Windfall

article_summary:
The revenue boom includes a huge 10.3%, or $144 billion, increase in individual tax payments to $1.538 trillion.
The federal government can celebrate record revenue of $3.249 trillion thanks to an 8% increase in receipts for the year.
Corporate tax receipts were only a little less generous, growing 7.3% to $344 billion.
The White House is crowing about the budget results for fiscal 2015, which ended September 30, and it’s true that Americans have been very generous to Washington.
Payroll taxes continued their steady...
